title: Carl Williams' widow Roberta has TV producer kidnapping charge dropped
text:
Gangland widow Roberta Williams has had her kidnapping charge dropped.

The wife of murdered underworld figure Carl Williams arrived at Melbourne Magistrates Court on Tuesday wearing Gucci trainers and carrying a Louis Vuitton clutch.

Three of the charges against her - including kidnapping and causing serious injury - were dropped.

Gangland widow Roberta Williams has arrived at court as three of her charges were dropped

The wife of murdered underworld figure Carl Williams arrived at Melbourne Magistrates Court on Tuesday wearing Gucci trainers and sported a Louis Vuitton clutch

Three of the charges against her - including kidnapping and causing serious injury - were dropped

One of Williams' co-accused Jake Sexton leaves the County Court of Victoria in Melbourne

It had been previously alleged Williams and her co-accused James Harrison and Jake Sexton kicked, punched and tied up TV producer Ryan Naumenko with a power cable at Collingwood on July 9, 2019.

The 50-year-old still faces allegations she threatened to kill the producer, who had been working on a reality show about her life.

Williams was arrested at a house at Strathmore a month after the alleged attack.

On Tuesday the mother arrived at court wearing Gucci trainers, which typically retail for $800, and carrying a Louis Vuitton clutch, which sells for $750.

She paired the items with a grey turtleneck sweater, a white undershirt and check-print trousers.

She kept her sunglasses on and toted a coffee as she made her way through reporters and into the court house.

It had been previously alleged Williams and her co-accused James Harrison and Jake Sexton kicked, punched and tied up TV producer Ryan Naumenko with a power cable at Collingwood on July 9, 2019

The 50-year-old still faces allegations she threatened to kill the producer, who had been working on a reality show about her life

Williams was arrested at a house at Strathmore a month after the alleged attack

The evening before her court appearance Williams took to social media to share a quote about karma.

'Karma has no limits, no boundaries and definitely no deadlines,' the social media post read.



She will remain on bail until her next scheduled court appearance in 2020.

The evening before her court appearance Williams took to social media to share a quote about karma

On Tuesday the mother arrived at court wearing Gucci trainers, which typically retail for $800, and a Louis Vuitton clutch, which typically retails for $750
description: The wife of murdered underworld figure Carl Williams arrived at Melbourne Magistrates Court on Tuesday wearing Gucci trainers and carrying a  Louis Vuitton clutch.
authors: Claudia Poposki For Daily Mail Australia
